org.jcaki
Class Files

java.lang.Object
  org.jcaki.Files

public class Files
extends java.lang.Object

Helper methods for File operations. File operations throws RuntimeException instead of IOException.

Nested Class Summary
static class Files.ExtensionFilter
           
static class Files.RegexpFilter
          This is a file filter using regular expressions.

Method Detail

deleteFiles

public static void deleteFiles(java.io.File... files)
This deletes files in a directory. it does not go into sub directories, and it does not delete directories.

Parameters:
files - : zero or more files.

files - : zero or more file or dorectory.

copyDirectory

                                 java.io.File dstDir)
                          throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
srcDir - Source directory
dstDir - destination directory
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an exception occurs during copy operation.

Returns:

containsUTF8Bom

public static boolean containsUTF8Bom(java.io.File file)
                               throws java.io.IOException
checks if input file contains UTF-8 BOM information. note that it is not required that UTF-8 files carries this information.

Parameters:
file - file to be checked.
Returns:
true if file contains UTF-8 bom data
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an error during file access.

appendFiles

public static void appendFiles(java.io.File target,
                               java.io.File... filesToAppend)
                        throws java.io.IOException
merges files into a single file. if the target file already exist, it appends it. if target does not exist, it creates it.

Parameters:
target - target file to be appended.
filesToAppend - filesToMerge
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an error during appending files.

hexDump

public static void hexDump(java.io.File f,
                           long amount)
                    throws java.io.IOException
This method dumps the contents of a file in hex format to console.

Parameters:
f - file to hex dump.
amount - amount of bytes to write. if this value is -1, then it dupms all the content.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem accessing the file.

hexDump

public static void hexDump(java.io.File f,
                           java.io.File out,
                           long amount)
                    throws java.io.IOException
This method dumps the contents of a file in hex format to another file.

Parameters:
f - file to hex dump.
out - the output file hex values will be written.
amount - amount of bytes to write. if this value is -1, then it dupms all the content.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem accessing the file.
